comments:
Build ID: I20070625-1500

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Create a new project
2. Create a new folder that is linked to an RSE resource
3. New -> File


More information:
The actual file is created on the target file system however when opening the file I am presented with a "File rse://...... does not exist" error.

When reviewing the error log it seems at some point a NullPointerException is generated. I have tried this issue for both a Java Project in the Java perspective as for PHP with PDT.

Java generates the following error in the log:

I usually have to restart eclipse (connecting and disconnecting the resource doesn't work) in order to be able to view the file.
This is a duplicate of bug #191581.  Using the latest IBuild (I20070906-0800) and Mylyn 2.0 I do not see either problem.

My previous response was in relation to the Java Perspective.

For PDT you will still have problems due to the fact that WST is not EFS aware.  You can follow bug #196172, for when this is resolved.

This is fixed with bug #191581 - please use a recent RSE I-build.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 191581 ***
